content.description: Sit start on lowest left crimp and small right hand slot crimp. Climb up and left with a huge span out to the arete, technical trickery helps you gain the start of the original line and finish straight up. Somewhat dabby but enjoyable
content.location: Sit start on lowest holds to the right of the arete but still up on the rock ledge

content.description: This is the original poison arrow line, absolute roadside classic - initially graded V9, it felt more like V7 to me but feel free to weigh in. Squat start with left hand on a pinch low on the arete and with right hand on a sidepull, climb straight up to a jug seam up and over the slab bulge.
content.location: From the parking lot hike east past the dead end pull out, follow the old road up and left to a boulder pile - approximately 500 yards.

content.description: Squat start right hand on a decent crimp and left hand low on the arete. Climb straight up on awesome holds. Somewhat lowball with a boulder that follows the landing but very good and somewhat dabby on the finish.
content.location: Easily visible from the parking lot.

content.description: Sit start on the arete and follow it to the top. Stand start on the jug for a decent warm up.
content.location: Hike approximately 500 yards east of the dead-end pull out.

content.description: A few high quality boulders near Goldwater Lake - called the carcase boulders. I am pretty unfamiliar with history of this area so if you have any names or FA information please let me know.
